title: Editors Choice Pictures
text:
Pictures | Wed Feb 28, 2018 | 5:05pm   
Smoke rises from the besieged Eastern Ghouta in Damascus, Syria. REUTERS/ Bassam Khabieh Reuters / Tuesday, February 27, 2018 Smoke rises from the besieged Eastern Ghouta in Damascus, Syria. REUTERS/ Bassam Khabieh Close 1 / 24 
White House Communications Director Hope Hicks leaves the U.S. Capitol after attending the House Intelligence Committee closed door meeting in   Tuesday, February 27, 2018 White House Communications Director Hope Hicks leaves the U.S. Capitol after attending the House Intelligence Committee closed door meeting in   2 / 24 
Tourists from Poland float in the Dead Sea during sunset, near Metzoke Dragot in the Israeli occupied West Bank. REUTERS/Ronen Zvulun Reuters / Tuesday, February 27, 2018 Tourists from Poland float in the Dead Sea during sunset, near Metzoke Dragot in the Israeli occupied West Bank. REUTERS/Ronen Zvulun Close 3 / 24 
The sun rises behind the Muenster Cathedral during a cold morning in Bern, Switzerland. Picture taken through a metal pipe. REUTERS/Stefan Wermuth Reuters / Wednesday, February 28, 2018 The sun rises behind the Muenster Cathedral during a cold morning in Bern, Switzerland. Picture taken through a metal pipe. REUTERS/Stefan Wermuth Close 4 / 24 
Damien Creller (L), 12, shoots during a clay target youth group shooting meeting in Sunrise, Florida. REUTERS/Joe Skipper Reuters / Tuesday, February 27, 2018 Damien Creller (L), 12, shoots during a clay target youth group shooting meeting in Sunrise, Florida. REUTERS/Joe Skipper Close 5 / 24 
Sri Lanka's Special Task Force (STF) members look on at a rescue demonstration during the 35th anniversary in Kalutara, Sri Lanka. REUTERS/Dinuka Liyanawatte Reuters / Tuesday, February 27, 2018 Sri Lanka's Special Task Force (STF) members look on at a rescue demonstration during the 35th anniversary in Kalutara, Sri Lanka. REUTERS/Dinuka Liyanawatte Close 6 / 24 
Worshippers shout slogans during a protest near the closed entrance to the Church of the Holy Sepulchre in Jerusalem's Old City. REUTERS/Ammar Awad Reuters / Tuesday, February 27, 2018 Worshippers shout slogans during a protest near the closed entrance to the Church of the Holy Sepulchre in Jerusalem's Old City. REUTERS/Ammar Awad Close 7 / 24 
An injured boy cries as he flees an area where air strikes hit a house in Saada, Yemen. REUTERS/Naif Rahma Reuters / Tuesday, February 27, 2018 An injured boy cries as he flees an area where air strikes hit a house in Saada, Yemen. REUTERS/Naif Rahma Close 8 / 24 
A widow daubed in colours takes part in Holi celebrations in the town of Vrindavan in the northern state of Uttar Pradesh, India. REUTERS/Adnan Abidi Reuters / Tuesday, February 27, 2018 A widow daubed in colours takes part in Holi celebrations in the town of Vrindavan in the northern state of Uttar Pradesh, India. REUTERS/Adnan Abidi Close 9 / 24 
The Soyuz MS-06 capsule carrying the crew of Joe Acaba and Mark Vande Hei of the U.S., and Alexander Misurkin of Russia descends beneath a parachute just before landing in a remote area outside the town of Dzhezkazgan (Zhezkazgan), Kazakhstan.... more Reuters / Wednesday, February 28, 2018 The Soyuz MS-06 capsule carrying the crew of Joe Acaba and Mark Vande Hei of the U.S., and Alexander Misurkin of Russia descends beneath a parachute just before landing in a remote area outside the town of Dzhezkazgan (Zhezkazgan), Kazakhstan. REUTERS/Alexander Nemenov/Pool Close 10 / 24 
A worshipper touches the closed doors of the Church of the Holy Sepulchre in Jerusalem's Old City. REUTERS/Ammar Awad Reuters / Tuesday, February 27, 2018 A worshipper touches the closed doors of the Church of the Holy Sepulchre in Jerusalem's Old City. REUTERS/Ammar Awad Close 
A sunk boat is seen in Bakarac, Croatia. REUTERS/Antonio Bronic Reuters / Tuesday, February 27, 2018 A sunk boat is seen in Bakarac, Croatia. REUTERS/Antonio Bronic Close 12 / 24 
A burning vehicle is seen during a major assault against militants by Egyptian Army's soldiers in the troubled northern part of the Sinai peninsula in Al Arish, Egypt. Ministry of Defence/via REUTERS Reuters / Tuesday, February 27, 2018 A burning vehicle is seen during a major assault against militants by Egyptian Army's soldiers in the troubled northern part of the Sinai peninsula in Al Arish, Egypt. Ministry of Defence/via REUTERS Close 13 / 24 
Sri Lanka's Special Task Force (STF) members perform at a demonstration during the 35th anniversary in Kalutara, Sri Lanka. REUTERS/Dinuka Liyanawatte Reuters / Tuesday, February 27, 2018 Sri Lanka's Special Task Force (STF) members perform at a demonstration during the 35th anniversary in Kalutara, Sri Lanka. REUTERS/Dinuka Liyanawatte Close 14 / 24 
Animal trainer Zoltan Horkai poses with his wolf, Morius, at the Animal Training Center in Godollo, Hungary. REUTERS/Bernadett Szabo Reuters / Tuesday, February 27, 2018 Animal trainer Zoltan Horkai poses with his wolf, Morius, at the Animal Training Center in Godollo, Hungary. REUTERS/Bernadett Szabo Close 15 / 24 
Models present creations by designer Maria Grazia Chiuri as part of her Autumn/Winter 2018-2019 women's ready-to-wear collection show for fashion house Dior during Fashion Week. REUTERS/Pascal Rossignol Reuters / Tuesday, February 27, 2018 Models present creations by designer Maria Grazia Chiuri as part of her Autumn/Winter 2018-2019 women's ready-to-wear collection show for fashion house Dior during Fashion Week. REUTERS/Pascal Rossignol Close 16 / 24 
Roosters fight during a local cockfighting event after Spring Festival holidays in Jinning, Yunnan province, China. REUTERS/Wong Campion Reuters / Wednesday, February 28, 2018 Roosters fight during a local cockfighting event after Spring Festival holidays in Jinning, Yunnan province, China. REUTERS/Wong Campion Close 17 / 24 
Cast members Mindy Kaling (L), Oprah Winfrey (C) and Reese Witherspoon pose for a portrait while promoting the movie "A Wrinkle in Time" in Los Angeles. REUTERS/Mario Anzuoni Reuters / Tuesday, February 27, 2018 Cast members Mindy Kaling (L), Oprah Winfrey (C) and Reese Witherspoon pose for a portrait while promoting the movie "A Wrinkle in Time" in Los Angeles. REUTERS/Mario Anzuoni Close 18 / 24 
Oscar statuettes sit in a safe at the Polich Tallix foundry before shipped to Epner technology to be electroplated in 24 carat gold in Walden, New York. REUTERS/Shannon Stapleton Reuters / Tuesday, February 27, 2018 Oscar statuettes sit in a safe at the Polich Tallix foundry before shipped to Epner technology to be electroplated in 24 carat gold in Walden, New York. REUTERS/Shannon Stapleton Close 19 / 24 
A Fulani woman fixes her head scalf on the street of Dapchi, Yobe state, Nigeria. REUTERS/Afolabi Sotunde Reuters / Tuesday, February 27, 2018 A Fulani woman fixes her head scalf on the street of Dapchi, Yobe state, Nigeria. REUTERS/Afolabi Sotunde Close 20 / 24 
Saturday Night Live comedian Leslie Jones reacts towards Golden State Warriors guard Stephen Curry during the second half against the New York Knicks at Madison Square Garden. Adam Hunger-USA TODAY Sports Reuters / Monday, February 26, 2018 Saturday Night Live comedian Leslie Jones reacts towards Golden State Warriors guard Stephen Curry during the second half against the New York Knicks at Madison Square Garden. Adam Hunger-USA TODAY Sports Close 21 / 24 
Shoes with flowers are pictured during a demonstration against the speech of Seyyed Ali Reza Avai, Minister of Justice of Iran, at the Human Rights Council, in front of the United Nations in Geneva, Switzerland. REUTERS/Denis Balibouse Reuters / Tuesday, February 27, 2018 Shoes with flowers are pictured during a demonstration against the speech of Seyyed Ali Reza Avai, Minister of Justice of Iran, at the Human Rights Council, in front of the United Nations in Geneva, Switzerland. REUTERS/Denis Balibouse Close 22 / 24 
Marjory   School shooting survivor Delaney Tarr walks with other survivors into the office of the House Speaker Paul Ryan for a meeting in the U.S. Capitol in   Tuesday, February 27, 2018 Marjory   School shooting survivor Delaney Tarr walks with other survivors into the office of the House Speaker Paul Ryan for a meeting in the U.S. Capitol in   
A horse stands in a snow covered field in Keele, Newcastle-under-Lyme, Britain. REUTERS/Carl Recine Reuters / Tuesday, February 27, 2018 A horse stands in a snow covered field in Keele, Newcastle-under-Lyme, Britain. REUTERS/Carl Recine Close
